column2: Now think about the past 30 days - that is, from [DATEFILL*] up to and including today. During the past 30 days, have you smoked part or all of a cigarette?
column9: DATEFILL is the date 30 days prior to the date of the interview.

column2: During the past 30 days, that is, since [DATEFILL*], on how many days did you smoke part or all of a cigarette?
column9: ASK IF Q1 = 1; DATEFILL is the date 30 days prior to the date of the interview.  Enter frequency in days.

column2: During the past 30 days, that is, since [DATEFILL*], on how many days did you smoke part or all of a cigarette?
What is your best estimate of the number of days you smoked part or all of a cigarette during the past 30 days?
column9: ASK IF Q2 = "Don't know" or "Refused"; DATEFILL is the date 30 days prior to the date of the interview.

column2: What is your best estimate of the number of days you smoked part or all of a cigarette during the past 30 days?
column9: ASK IF Q2 = "Don't know" or "Refused"; DATEFILL is the date 30 days prior to the date of the interview.

column2: On the [NUMBER OF DAYS REPORTED IN 2a OR 2b] you smoked cigarettes during the past 30 days, how many cigarettes did you smoke per day, on average?
column17: 1 = Less than one cigarette per day
column23: 7 = More than 35 cigarettes per day (about 2 packs or more)

column2: On the [NUMBER OF DAYS REPORTED IN 2a OR 2b] you smoked cigarettes during the past 30 days, how many cigarettes did you smoke per day, on average?
